revised_title: Waveguides and Wavetrains: A Study of Slowly Varying Propagation
tldr: The article discusses the application of the WKB approximation to a general system of linear partial differential equations describing waves in any waveguide with slowly varying properties. The theory focuses on slowly varying wavetrains, with oscillations locally in one of the normal modes of a waveguide. The governing equations are derived from a variational principle, and the article demonstrates how to construct higher-order approximations and integrate them by quadrature.
